page.title: 16Wild Life around Crathie
page.content: In Crathie we are surrounded by a lot of wild life. There are numerous tiny animals around the trees. It is easy to spot one of the many local red squirrels. Plenty of rabbits make their holes beside bushes and eat everything in the garden. There are a lot of moles too. In the woods and forests there are roe deer and up in the hills there are herds of red deer which will move onto lower ground during severe weather. Sometimes you see a fox in the woods. Also up in the hills adders hide in the heather. They are very poisonous. Hedgehogs live under cut down trees and if you touch one it will roll into a prickly ball. Sometimes if you are lucky you might see an otter at a river bank. In the winter the stoat and hare have white coats. Possibly wild cats and pine martens live in the more remote parts.
